properties.areaDesc: Central and Southwest Mountains; Wasatch Plateau/Book Cliffs; Wasatch Mountains I-80 North; Southern Utah Mountains; Western Uinta Mountains; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80
properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 2 at 7:47AM MST until February 4 at 4:00AM MST by NWS Salt Lake City UT
properties.description:
* WHAT...Heavy snow and areas of blowing snow expected. Total
snow accumulations of 8 to 16 inches. Winds gusting as high as
55 mph.

* WHERE...Wasatch Plateau/Book Cliffs, Western Uinta Mountains,
Wasatch Mountains South of I-80, Wasatch Mountains I-80 North,
Southern Mountains and Central Mountains.

* WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to 4 AM MST Tuesday, with the
period of heaviest snowfall Monday morning.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Hazardous travel
conditions are expected to impact the Monday morning and
evening commutes. Blowing snow will cause poor visibility.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The cold wind chills as low as 25 below
zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30
minutes.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

For graphical depictions of the snowfall forecast, including
Official NWS Forecast, High End Amount, and Low End Amount, visit
weather.gov/slc/winter.

For winter road conditions from the Utah Department of
Transportation, visit
http://www.udottraffic.utah.gov/roadweatherforecast.aspx or dial
511.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 4 AM MST TUESDAY
